sp.speaker: News Anchor
sp.p: : In local news, child murderer Joseph Eli Lipnip is scheduled to die tomorrow by lethal injection, his execution already drawing dozens more spectators than the death of TV news. Carla?

sp.p: : Your best friend -- Tommy. We know. Stop true-crime bragging.

sp.p: : Bitch, my generation gets traumatized for breakfast.

sp.p: : It took years of therapy to even process the reality. I mean, when I was a kid, I just told myself that Tommy had gotten lost in the magical realm of Froopyland.

sp.p: :"Froopyland?"

sp.p: : My make-believe world. I know the name’s stupid, but it was so real to me.

sp.p: :[ Rattling ] [ Grunting ] Here it is. You know, I collapsed a quantum tesseract to

sp.p: : Okay, ‘cause he, um Yeah, he didn’t want to come back, so, um, he gave me this.

sp.p: : He gave you his finger?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Uh, well, what happened is

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : -- It’s okay. It doesn’t matter.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Okay.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : This’ll take about three hours.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Okay.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Hey. You want to help?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Okay.

body.stage: (music while beth and rick make clone of tommy{ Doo I got a doo-doo in my butt Doo-doo-doo-doo And I don’t know what to do With the doo-doo in my butt But I know that a father should say to you That he’s proud of you Doo Every daughter is a doo-doo from a father’s butt Biologically speaking, the butt is a nut And every father fathers wrong Ooh And there isn’t a song That can change that })

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : I am wiped out. I guess I’ll turn in.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Cool.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Dad? I feel like I’ve spent my life pretending you’re a great guy and trying to be like you. And the ugly truth has always been

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : -- That I’m not that great a guy and you’re exactly like me.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Am I evil?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Worse. You’re smart. When you know nothing matters, the universe is yours. And I’ve never met a universe that was into it. The universe is basically an animal. It grazes on the ordinary. It creates infinite idiots just to eat them, not unlike your friend Timmy.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Tommy.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Yeah, it hardly matters now, sweetie. You know, smart people get a chance to climb on top, take reality for a ride, but it’ll never stop trying to throw you. And, eventually, it will. There’s no other way off.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Dad, I’m out of excuses to not be who I am. So who am I? What do I do?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : My advice -- Take off. Put a saddle on your universe. Let it kick itself out.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : I can’t do that. The kids, Jerry, my job, and, as much as I hate to admit it, ABC’s "The Bachelor."

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : I can make a clone of you, a perfect instance of you, with all your memories. An exact copy in every way. It’ll love and provide for the kids, do your job, and consume broadcast-network reality TV on the same allegedly ironic level as you. You could be gone a day, a week, or the rest of your life with zero consequences. The moment you decide to come back, I flip a switch, and the clone’s job is done. It feels no pain, it regrets nothing, and has zero chance of going "Blade Runner."

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : If nothing matters, why would you do that for me?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : I don’t know, maybe you matter so little that I like you. Or maybe it makes you matter. Maybe I love you. Maybe something about your mother. Don’t jump a gift shark in the mouth.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : I don’t know if I can do it.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Then stay, and luxuriate in a life you can finally know you’ve chosen. My secret bonus is that no matter what you choose, you’re finally gonna chill the [bleep] out.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Okay. I know what I want to do.

sp.speaker: Kiara
sp.p: : [ Whoosh ] Aah! [ Thud ] Ow! You can’t run forever!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : She’s really pissed off.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : I know. It’s kinda hot.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Shut up!

sp.speaker: Varrix
sp.p: : The hunters! They’re back! Run!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : -We’re not hunters.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : -We want to hide with you.

sp.speaker: Varrix
sp.p: : We’re not hiding. We’re nesting.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Ooh la la.

sp.speaker: Kiara
sp.p: : [ All scream ] The children must be destroyed so that we can be together.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : You need to break up with her, Dad -- properly! [ Whoosh ] God damn it, Dad! [ Grunts ] Dump her!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Okay, okay. Kiara, let’s just run away.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : -Dad!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: :-Come on!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Just rip the Band-Aid off!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Okay! Kiara, when I told you my kids were bigoted racists who were demanding I break up with you, I lied. If anybody deserves to be telekinetically strangled, it’s me. I’m the one who wants to break up. I -- I’m not an evil person. I’m lazy, I’m cowardly, and -- and I do not know what I’m doing. Look, I got someone pregnant at 17. We’re getting a divorce. None of this is on purpose. I was excited to date someone cool because it would make my ex notice me.

sp.speaker: Kiara
sp.p: : I would expect nothing less from humanity -- a selfish, manipulative, dishonest species that

sp.speaker: Trandor
sp.p: :-- -Kiara?

sp.speaker: Kiara
sp.p: : -Trandor!

sp.speaker: Trandor
sp.p: : What are you doing here?

sp.speaker: Kiara
sp.p: : Just hunting.

sp.speaker: Trandor
sp.p: : Do you really expect me to believe it has nothing to do with us? You knew Earth was my domain.

sp.speaker: Kiara
sp.p: : I don’t like what you’re insinuating.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Dad, can we go now?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Hold on a second. I’m starting to get the feeling that I was the rebound.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Dad, you just got handed an Ex Machina. You’re taking it.

sp.speaker: Trandor
sp.p: : Varrix nests spread across 300 galaxies, and you just happened to pick this planet to hunt? That’s Gorgon shit -- total Gorgon shit!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : We’re home!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Hey, guys!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : What’s for dinner?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : How was Jerry’s?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : The usual. Can we have pizza?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Pizza sounds great.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Hey, Rick, did you know my dad was dating an alien? No.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Gross.: For the alien.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Aw, crap, I think Arnaldo’s is closed. Are you guys sure you want pizza?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : [ Whoosh ] Arnaldo’s isn’t closed in the dimension where they didn’t invent Daylight Savings!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : What would we do without you? I love you, Dad.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Love you, too, sweetie. By the way, that wasn’t time travel. There were just a couple pizzas on the counter. I grabbed them.

sp.speaker: Kiara
sp.p: : [ Beep ] Hey, Jerry, it’s Kiara. Listen, my boyfriend saw those texts you’ve been sending me, and he got pretty pissed off. If he calls you, just ignore him! [ Beep ]

sp.speaker: Carmox
sp.p: : [ Beep ] This is Carmox. I have intercepted sexual communications between you and my new girlfriend, Kiara. I am coming to kill you now! [ Beep ]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : [ Beep]Yo, Jerry, it’s the Big R. Uh, I killed that alien that was coming after ya. Looking out for ya, buddy. [ Beep ] [ Beep ] Hey, Jerry, it’s Rick. Don’t be mad. I [bleep] your ex-girlfriend Kiara.

sp.speaker: Kiara
sp.p: :Who are you talking to, Rick? Doesn’t matter.

sp.speaker: Michael
sp.p: :Hey, Jerry, this is Michael down at The Antique Phone rentals. Um, I’m gonna go ahead and let you off the hook for the $70 late fee. You can go ahead and keep that answering machine. Nobody really uses those anymore except for exposition on TV shows, anyways.
